block.p: Sarah Pursley Smith, a daughter of Dr. Margaret Smith of New York and Dr. Dallas Edwards Smith of Albuquerque, was married yesterday to Gardiner Bradford Welch, a son of Mr. and Mrs. James O. Welch Jr. of Short Hills, N.J. The Rev. William O. Sparks, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at the home of the bride's paternal grandmother, Eugenia Douglas Fleet, in New Kent, Va.

Mrs. Welch, 27, is developing a marketing company in New York, to be called Red Scout. She graduated from Georgetown University. Her father, who specializes in internal medicine and rheumatology, has a private practice in Albuquerque. Her mother is the director of the rheumatology program at St. Vincents Hospital and Medical Center in Manhattan, and is an assistant professor of medicine at the New York Medical College in Valhalla, N.Y. The bride is a stepdaughter of Janet Smith and of Dr. Matthew J. Ferguson, a general practitioner in Manhattan.
